Barcelona Universal Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 777 reviews

Stayed 4 nights in September and really liked the hotel. We had a triple room with two large windows on the eighth floor which meant we had great views.

The room was very nice, clean and comfortable and had tea and coffee facilities. There are, however, some rooms I believe which only have small windows which overlook inner courtyards but you find that in most hotels. The rooftop has a great sundeck area with a pool, bar and wonderful views. It also has a gym but this is small with a few running machines and a small weights area. The metro stop is just outside the hotel's entrance so from the airport we took the train to the main train station and then it was just two stops on the metro to the hotel. We bought a T10 ticket for 10 euros which gives 10 journeys (the same ticket can be used by each person - no need to buy individual ones). Our journey took less than one hour and 15 minutes from the airport to hotel and therefore this counts only as one journey per person so we only used 3 journeys on the card and had 7 journeys left to use on other metro trips! A cheap and easy way to and from the airport. The hotel is only 5 minutes walk from Las Ramblas and 5 minutes the other way to the port area which was very nice. Would definitely choose this hotel again as I loved the rooftop area and pool.

Show more
Anne , United Kingdom
Gran Torre Catalunya Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 525 reviews

We had a wonderful stay apart from the king size bed being two beds joined together and kept parting like the red sea during the night.

We were moved to another room but it was on the eight floor and looked tired and worn. We were then moved to the 21st floor which was much better and more comfortable. The breakfasts were wonderful and once again the views from the restaurant were truly spectacular. The exclusive bar on the ground floor was very good and all the staff we met were so so helpful which was a credit to the hotel. The location was fantastic right next to the Sans railway station and was only 20 minutes from the airport and downtown by metro was only 10 minutes max. I will definitely be going back ony next visit

Show more
maninderjit , United Kingdom
Expo Barcelona Hotel
7.7 Very good
Based on 775 reviews

The hotel is excellent to reach and the location feels quite safe even by night for two women. We haven't had breakfast in the hotel as there are quite a few cafés nearby, so we can't commend on that.

The room was cleaned okay. The staff did not move the small and light on-board suitcases away during our 4 day stay, so there was a little dust by the second day at this corner. The beds and towels looked clean, and where made/exchanged daily. The built-in hair dryer in the bathroom was a joke. It barely "breathed" warm air, took me nearly 20 minutes just to dry chin length hair. We did not ask for a better hair dryer though. The rooms were narrow, but roomy and had a very barren look. Just plain white walls, a table, one chair and two plain beds that shared a nightstand (without power outlet, those were distributed near the floor at two completely different corners). There was even a small old television (those of the nearly cubicle sort that made the table bend under its weight). Our two single beds were on the smaller side with wheels that squeaked a little when falling onto the bed too hard. They were a little hard, too, which we liked though. There was also a rather roomy walk-in closet. All in all, the hotel was okay. It was the cheapest hotel (~60€/night for a twin double around New Years) that we could get on such short notice that was not a hostel or completely outside the city. It does not earn 4 stars though. I have been in better 3 stars and much better 4 stars for half the price with outstanding service (the service was okay, albeit very "efficient" in communication).

Show more
Phuong-Ha , Germany
Moderno Hotel
7.9 Very good
Based on 730 reviews

I stayed here for 4 nights returning home yesterday. I had a lovely modern room with a double bed, very comfortable.

Everything was spotless, room and hotel very clean. It is right in the centre of Las Ramblas so great location. The bus stop is only around the corner. Metro is also very close. The staff are lovely and very helpful, particularly Javi. I was a solo traveller, and he was very nice and helpful. Breakfast was nice but not a lot of fruit, just a whole apple or orange, (I missed my fruit salad), but that's a small thing. There is no bar, but there is a restaurant next door. Only other negative was that the room had no natural light, as it faced internally, and not much space for clothes if I had not been travelling alone. I think external facing rooms have balconies, but they face the street, so maybe there would be more noise at night. I never heard a sound in my room, and slept very well. All on all, I was very happy with my stay here. Negatives were very small, and for me everything suited my needs. Clean, modern and comfortable, very central, and staff were lovely. I would recommend for solo travellers or couples, and I would stay here again.

Show more
Marie , Ireland
Barcelona Airport Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 699 reviews

We stayed at BAH after a late night flight arrival pre-cruise as well as prior to our early morning International return flight to USA.

Each time the shuttle service was efficient, The hotel is a typical airport hotel - clean with large rooms and free internet. The pool was closed for the season, but we wouldn't have had time to use the facilities anyway. The restaurant menu is limited, but certainly sufficient for our needs. The hotel is located in an industrial park, so don't expect much in terms of alternate dining. There is, however, a coffee shop within walking distance. We heard some people will use the BAH as a base for Barcelona and take the subway and/or bus into the city because the hotel rates are considerably less than staying in the heart of the city. I can't speak personally to this idea because we stayed in an apartment just off Las Ramblas for three nights prior to spending our last night at BAH. BAH was definitely a good hotel for our purposes and I wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Show more
Mary , United States
Hotel Nouvel
7.9 Very good
Based on 86 reviews

Great location as a base to explore Barcelona from. Situated in a street corner of the Ramblas, making retreats to room after a long day a good wind down, yet still being close to the charms of Barcelona.

Location perfect for easy access to Metros, car rentals, airport bus, Carrefour, shopping, sights - all within 5-15mins walk away. As for the hotel itself, a good comfortable stay. Rooms & beds are small as typical European style, but still sufficient space for 2 big luggages. The bathroom is really pleasant; clean brown marble furnishing with separate shower stall, keeping the sink and toilet area dry always. The frosted glass wall separating the bathroom from room itself is really stylish. Few inconveniences: no mini bar (for keeping yoghurt and fruits), small fee for in-room safe use, deposit for tv remote and chargeable WiFi use ($2euro/hr). Tip: For traveling in Metro/bus, use T-10 tickets. This ticket is sharable (for 2 person use - scan ticket twice on metro/bus entry) and cuts the cost by half. Cost $9.80euro for 10 trips vs $2euro for single tickets. Super convenient and economical for traveling around the city.

Show more
Ai , Malaysia
Pulitzer Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 386 reviews

Design of the reception, the restaurant and bar is modern and chic. Room is clean with flat screen television, bath robe and warm decor.

Location is really great, we shop, drop off our shopping stuff back at the hotel and can head out again as it is near many boutiques, La Bouqueria market, not too far from the Christmas market or the Columbus Monument at the port. The receptionist are cordially polite. However, the reciptionist need to put more effort in improving the knowledge of restaurants and boutiques. As an example, I enquired about the location of Massimo Dutti boutique and I was told of a boutique on Catalunya Rambla No 40 (or 40+ something, cannot quite remember) which took us about 15-20 minutes to walk from the hotel when there is one boutique on the street just behind the hotel, 2 minutes round the corner from hotel. I was really surprised when I saw that Massimo Dutti outlet behind the hotel later. How could the receptionist not know! I also asked the receptionist to assist us to book dinner at the Cal Pep restauarant and I was told that that eatery is a tapas place and no reservation is required. That information was NOT altogether exactly correct as reservation is necessary for any party of 4 and more person. No reservation is needed for 1-3 persons.

Show more
BEE , Singapore
Olivia Plaza Hotel
8.7 Excellent
Based on 424 reviews

We had 8 nights in Barcelona and initially wanted to stay at different districts. Due to the hassle of moving luggages, we decided to just book one hotel and i guess by sheer luck, we booked Olivia Plaza.

The airport transfer which cost 5.90 euros one way stopped 2 mins from this hotel at the plaza Catalunya. So that was amazing. Upon check in, it must be another stroke of luck that we met marko/marco who gave us a map and brief us on everything good in the area. This hotel is at the intersection of 2 main shopping streets. La Rambla to the left, Passeig de Gracia slightly to the right. Everything you wanted to buy in Barcelona, i suppose you could find it within walking distance. It is also a short 2 mins walk to the train station. So getting around is really convenient. Now for some cons. If you don't like people, then this hotel being in a busy district is not for you. As mentioned by some other travellers, things do break down in the room. The 1st room we stayed in had a crack in the glass. Cold air was coming in. We were upgraded to other room the next day. The next room had a creaky toilet door. We spoke to the reception and they repaired it while we were out. And they offered us another upgrade to a plaza facing room! This time we declined because we were already comfortably settled in the room. So while things do break down, service recovery was prompt and sincere. Barcelona is a walking town and from this hotel, i believe you can get to many of the attractions that Barcelona has to offer. Good hotel to explore the city from. Without a doubt, i will stay here again.

Show more
Shawn , Singapore
Ohla Barcelona Hotel
8.9 Excellent
Based on 145 reviews

Our stay at Ohla Barcelona lasted three days so don't mistake this for a single over-nighter. Our stay included a Junior Suite and despite the comments regarding the shower, ours was not in the middle of the room (we did, however, see one of these in another room).

The bed was very comfortable and attention to detail was taken in the design of the room - quite modern. For those familiar with the restaurant 'The Melting Pot', the design kind of reminded me of that... a compliment to both Ohla House and The Melting Pot. The room was kept very neat. A couple things - I thought the shower floor was a bit slippery when initially wet. The tub is HUGE... even a big guy fits in there. The balconies on our suite were unusable. The pool is on the roof and is amazing but perhaps outdone by the view of continual beauty in all directions in view from the roof. The sunrises and sunsets on the roof should not be missed. Highlights - beauty of the hotel, friendliness of the staff, location is perfect. Would I stay again or recommend to a friend? You bet I would.

Show more
David , United States
Pol & Grace Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 214 reviews

We choose this hotel because of the pictures which included what appeared to be a small room attached to the main bedroom.

However our room was a simple room with no attached room so the picture on the website does not represent what you get. Also the room we had was on the first floor and if you opened the curtains passing traffic could see into the room so with closed curtains the room was dark. The walls of the room are thin so that it can be noisy from television noise, others in toilet, etc from other rooms. Although we are smokers we were getting cigarette smells into the room, most likely from the hallway where there is an ashtray stand. Staff are helpful and efficient.

Show more
Renato , Australia
Gotico Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 106 reviews

The stay was only OK. The hotel did not seem to fit the guidelines for 4 stars. The A/C was not working in our room on arrival.

It was remedied quickly when we reported the problem. The only A/c control was fan speed and that was hardly noticeable. You could not really detect the difference between position one and position three. Our only English language station on TV was Russia Today. The room was comfortable otherwise.

Show more
William , United States
Catalonia Barcelona Plaza Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 158 reviews

The Catalonia Plaza uses its proximity to the Aerobus (a direct and easy link to the airport) to charge high prices and provide little in terms of value to it's clients.

The rooms are large and generally clean (with the exception of the clump of hair in the bathtub). However, they are well used and need an overhaul. The room that I was provided looked out over a mouldy inner courtyard and had a musty smell. For the price I was charged I expect a much better experience. I would stay at this hotel again for half the rate that was charged (I paid $) I had to read the room service menu a couple of times to be sure I understood that a "continental breakfast; which is not described and the full breakfast each cost 16 Euro. There are no coffee machines in the rooms (which is typical) but neither is just a pot of coffee listed on the room service menu. When I asked in the restaurant downstairs I was told they did not offer just coffee; you have to pay for the entire 16 Euro breakfast options. There are many hotels that are well located that offer better value for the money.

Show more
Kimm , Canada
Hotel Negresco Princess
8.8 Excellent
Based on 59 reviews

We booked a Superior room for a long weekend break. Upon arrival found the promised views from the room were a first floor view onto a busy junction, meaning we felt exposed leaving the curtains open.

..but ok this is a city...the extent of the promised free minibar was a single beer, so tried to call to see if this was correct but of course the telephone didn't work (and never did for our whole stay even tho reported!) But these were minor problems and would be forgotten if the rest went smoothly... Day one the pool and terrace were closed for a private party - no apology Night two there was no electricity in our room for the evening, so my wife had to dry and straighten her hair in the lobby!! - no real apology, tiny cake delivered the next day?! Night two and day three the air conditioning was not working in our room - no apology (apparently "some people don't feel the heat"). After complaining got moved to an inferior room with no recompense...but it did have AC! To make it worse most staff didn't seem to care, only one, Beatrix (not Beatriz who was terrible), ever seemed sorry! Cleanliness is marked down due there being mould in the shower. This is not a cheap hotel and really did not expect this poor service. Would never recommend.

Show more
Ben , United Kingdom
Medinaceli Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 287 reviews

Overall this hotel was value for money if booked at Agoda. But maybe we booked too late and hotel price went up.

The hotel site offers were not as favourable as Agoda supplied. So we booked with Agoda. We were offered a room with 3 beds, because we travel with a young child. 2 Beds were put together as a big bed and a single bed was made up for my child. Beds were of good quality. The room was not facing the small park in front of the hotel, but at the back side. Room was spacious. The hotel and its rooms were clean. Unfortunately, the drain of our first roomtook an hour to flow away the shower water. After informing the hotel reception they couldn't do anything about it, because it was Sunday. So we were given another room. just 3 levels above our previous room. Here we experienced the same drain problem. This drain in room ook more than 10 minutes to flow the showered water away. It means you have to wash out your feet again after having showered, as 1 inch or about 2 cm of your feet will be standing in showeered water. I think all rooms on the other levels will be the same (. It must be a contractors problem. Hotel was quite flexible, as we checked out 1 hour later than allowed. Wifi too slow and often falls out. So, I used my own internet package.

Show more
Tin-Ho , Netherlands
Ilunion Barcelona Hotel
7.9 Very good
Based on 164 reviews

I enjoyed this hotel, the beds were spacious in my twin beds room, and it's speckless. I liked how we can open the windows to let in the breeze, and the heater was new and we could control the air conditioning.

As far as location goes, it is accessible and a short ride from the El Prat airport, but it isn't close to the tourist sights and has a limited choice of eateries in the immediate surrounding. In the hotel itself there's one restaurant that serves average food and room service. The concierge staff persons are helpful but none of them smile much (we met at least 6, not one of them smiled at any point).

Show more
CHEUNG , Hong Kong
W Barcelona Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 86 reviews

This hotel is my favorite. I like the design, the staff is very good, the bed is the best i know so far.

We book this hotel every year, because we like barcelona and especialy we love this hotel so much. The location, the rooms, the staff, the food, the room service, the breakfast, the coffee, everything we love in this hotel. The Hotel is not cheap, but compared to other famous cities it is very cheap, and it´s an 5 Star hotel. the Breakfast could be cheaper, but we love it, and the selction is great and premium quality (you get also excellent ham or hearty dishes, etc.) The best of this hotel is the excellent bed. We think about to buy such a bed because it´s so fantastic. You will also love the excellent amenities in the bathroom, SPLISS-SPA products from Canada.

Show more
Marcus , Germany
Catalonia Portal De L'Angel Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 149 reviews

Booked the cheapest room for 5 nights based on proximity to public transport. Didn't realize it meant being in the center of shopping mall which meant you emerged from the comparative quiet of the hotel right into the center of the tourist & shopping stream which turned out to be a buzz! The room itself was adequate although it looked out into light well but why pay extra euros (I think 15 to 30) for features you're not there to see?) The historic remnants of the buildinG are few but the staircase remains.

This turned out to be a great spot for public transport - 200 meters to main connecting lines of subway, airport buses (fabulous), walk to many attractions, restaurants etc. Staff were not particularly friendly but then they did their job and I'm not looking for new friends. However the heavy double glazed window in our room fell off its hinges. We managed to shut it again, but had to report it twice and wait 2 days for it to be repaired and then it fell out again. On leaving they tried to charge us for breakfast but quickly canceled it and apologised. Minor problems ( although the window was quite dangerous) but I would use this place again based on location.

Show more
Greg , Australia
Gran Barcino Hotel
7.3 Very good
Based on 164 reviews

The reception was manned by a surly chap who looked frustrated and everything seemed a chore! Truly felt he thought all the guests were wanting the leave without paying the city tax, it wAs his main priority.

He asked us to pay for the room despite the fact it was already paid via Agoda. Luckily, I didn't have the credit card at the time and later the other chap on reception confirmed it has been paid.. W asked for a couple of wine glasses, but non available. The porter went to the bar (never open) and ran his finger along the back bar where there were a couple of tumblers...he showed us the dirty dust mark - not a good start. Our room was on the top floor next to the maids laundry room. The door constantly banged shut. On the sat eve we couldn't get out of the hotel for all the protesters outside, literally 1000s blocking the street and square. The maid did a good cleaning job of the room. The shower head didn't stay in the holder so you had to hold it to shower. The breakfast was adequate - I wouldn't recommend it to fellow Brits. The price was highs as a holiday weekend, personally, we didn't feel it was worth the money, better options in the central location.

Show more
sally , United Kingdom
Rialto Hotel
7.5 Very good
Based on 144 reviews

from the outside, and even from the lobby, it looked pleasant. the staff seemed stressed and disorganised.

i'd booked in 9 of us over 4 rooms, and each one of us were, to put it politely, less than satisfied. my room had a window that had metal sheeting over it with very tiny strips, that was the elevator shaft. it being new years, it was a very busy oft throughout the night! our air conditioning wouldn't go below 23. so with no windows and no air conditioning it was horribly claustrophobic in there. there were no complimentary toiletries, our bath was dirty and so were our towels. upon leaving, we asked the 2 staff behind the desk if we could leave our bags. without looking up they told us to "go ahead, the door was open". when collecting our bags, same rile applied. we walked behind the desk where our bags were, took them, and as i left i said "thank you, i hope you don't mind but i've stolen a bag" to absolutely no reply, just a hand wave. terrible hotel. shame because the location was excellent.

Show more
kate , United Kingdom
Best Western Premier Dante Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 143 reviews

We stayed 6 nights in the hotel. The room is spacous, shower (facilities, water pressure) is acceptable.

The staffs are able to speak English and they were very helpful. The hotel provides power adaptor and help me to set up the free wifi on my laptop. (We stayed in Spain for 2 weeks, stayed in 5 other 4 stars hotels and were surprised when other hotels did not provide these fundamental services, get rude treatment because we cannot speak spainish). The bad point for this hotel is the location is rather out of place. I can only write a very positive review of this hotel "Catalonia Duques de Bergara". My stay there was not planned, but next time I travel to Barcelona, I will definitely stay here.

I was going to Barcelona for work, but whilst I was there, I also fancied seeing some of the sights, eating out, and doing some shopping. In every way, this hotel was perfectly placed. I arrived on the airport bus at the bus stop just over Plaça de Catalunya. This is a minute's walk from the hotel. If you fancy going out shopping, it's very easy to just come back to the hotel to drop your bags and go out again, because the shops are everywhere around the location of the hotel. Several friends who were also in Barcelona at the same time, used my hotel room as a place to leave their shopping bags :-) If you would like to see much more of the city, one can take the Metro from outside the hotel on Plaça de Catalunya. This is something I did only once, as I hired a bike afterwards. The hotel room was great, with a balcony looking out over the pool, and comfortable bed and clean bathroom with both shower and bath. Breakfast had a very good choice of food, and it was included in the price: another plus! I can highly recommend staying in the hotel to make an excellent stay in Barcelona smooth, trouble-free and so that you can make the most of your time in the city, without unnecessary extra travelling to and from your hotel. I can't wait to go back!!

H10 Cubik does not live up to its high ratings online. The new hotel looks really good but that does not make up for their atrocious service.

We booked a junior suite for 3 nights. Unfortunately, our flight got changed and we called the hotel to see what we can do about the extra night. I fully understand that it is a non-refundable booking, but it was the way it was delivered that leaves a bad taste in your mouth before you even begin your holiday experience. I travel alot and good hotels will at least offer to try and check with a manager or something. This hotel was just a flat no regardless of what we said. I have actually left a hotel once because of the lumpy mattress in their suite. We were willing to forfeit our payment and did not complain to management. However, the manager showed up and insisted to know why we were leaving after checking in. We finally told him and not only did he waive all three nights but recommended us to another hotel. Now, that was a hotel that lived up to their high ratings as they truly care about their customer's experience and made our holiday memorable. H10 does not have a concierge service and their front desk staff are not very friendly. Lastly, we were supposed to be appreciative of the room upgrade at the front desk to suite vs junior suite. However, the rooms are not very different, just comes with doors that separates the bedroom from the ONLY aircon in the living room. The bed though comfortable has pillows that are too soft. I stayed at Pension Solarium for one night. I was amused by the appearance of the hotel, the reception being a three-storey climb away from the entrance, the conditions in the rooms etc.

But I was overall satisifed with my stay. I got a room that smelled like there had been smoked for a couple of days inside, which they agreed to change immediately after I asked (although only one of the people at the reception could speak English, the other could not at all -- which really wasn't an issue, but still). The room I got then was clean and very comfortable for the price. They also provided towels for when you use the shower, of which there is only one on each floor - so if travelling in high season, this should be kept in mind as there will probably be queues longer than the one I experienced (0 people). I missed the duvet cover though. And in 8.56 in the morning it felt like somebody started to bulldoze the very building I was having a good morning sleep in. The walls and floors started to rumble and the noise was so frickin loud, I couldn't even hear my own thoughts, let alone continue to sleep. But the check out is at 11AM, so I guess I just considered the bulldozing as a really irritating alarm clock... Very interesting place for sure. Would recommend for a one night stay for those who are travelling on a budget and wish to experience something amusing in the near-center of BCN. A lot of good places to go out to in the proximity, a nice vibrant night life going on in the surroundings, but it was quiet at night (much more so than in other hotels I have tried in BCN). Oh, and there IS wifi in the rooms!!

We took our 74 and 78 year old parents with us to Europe, and after staying at hotels in other cities, we decided to try to stay in an apartment in Barcelona.

We chose an apt close to the Sagrada Familia, arguably the ultimate landmark in Barcelona. The Dailyflats managed the rental of several flats in Barcelona and other cities. It appeared to us that they were managing the business very efficiently, and perhaps as part of the cost-effectiveness strategy is to limit the time for check ins, and you can only do a check in at a designated office which can be far from where the apartment you are renting is located. This was our case. We arrived at the apt in the morning, and had realized later that we had to go to another building to get the key, and yet another building to leave our suitcases. And then we found out that they had switched our apt to another... a newer / nicer one, but still caused slight inconvenience to move the luggages - with seniors dragging the suitcases. Overall, the apartment was very cleaned, well maintained and well equipped with washing machines, kitchen utensils, etc. The staff were very nice and helpful. More about Barcelona

The capital of Catalonia, Barcelona is Spain's most fashionable city. This polished metropolis features world-famous architecture, beautiful museums, and some of the best shopping in Europe. The city is served by Barcelona Airport, a dual-terminal facility located just a few miles outside the city center. Business travelers and those making a short stopover often choose to stay in hotels near Barcelona Airport.

The architecture in Barcelona is nothing short of stunning. Most of the buildings in the historic neighborhood of Ciutat Vella were built between the 13th and 15th centuries, laying the foundation for what has become the most complete Gothic quarter in the world. With gargoyles watching from cathedrals and fountains that light up the streets after dark, this is historic Barcelona at its best. Enjoy a stroll down the historic Ramblas Street and experience Barcelona like a local.

The neighborhood of Eixample is where some of the most impressive modernist buildings can be found. The most impressive of these is Antoi Gaudi's masterpiece, the Sagrada Familia, which is the most visited monument in Spain.

It’s easy to see why Barcelona has been a global sensation for decades. From its bustling Mediterranean port and lively boardwalk to the flamenco dance clubs and, this dynamic city is not one to be missed.

There’s much more to see and learn about Barcelona, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this beautiful city.

We had a triple room with two large windows on the eighth floor which meant we had great views. The room was very nice, clean and comfortable and had tea and coffee facilities. There are, however, some rooms I believe which only have small windows which overlook inner courtyards but you find that in most hotels. The rooftop has a great sundeck area with a pool, bar and wonderful views. It also has a gym but this is small with a few running machines and a small weights area. The metro stop is just outside the hotel's entrance so from the airport we took the train to the main train station and then it was just two stops on the metro to the hotel. We bought a T10 ticket for 10 euros which gives 10 journeys (the same ticket can be used by each person - no need to buy individual ones). Our journey took less than one hour and 15 minutes from the airport to hotel and therefore this counts only as one journey per person so we only used 3 journeys on the card and had 7 journeys left to use on other metro trips! A cheap and easy way to and from the airport. The hotel is only 5 minutes walk from Las Ramblas and 5 minutes the other way to the port area which was very nice. Would definitely choose this hotel again as I loved the rooftop area and pool. Show more Anne , United Kingdom Gran Torre Catalunya Hotel 8.4 Excellent Based on 525 reviews We had a wonderful stay apart from the king size bed being two beds joined together and kept parting like the red sea during the night. We were moved to another room but it was on the eight floor and looked tired and worn. We were then moved to the 21st floor which was much better and more comfortable. The breakfasts were wonderful and once again the views from the restaurant were truly spectacular. The exclusive bar on the ground floor was very good and all the staff we met were so so helpful which was a credit to the hotel. The location was fantastic right next to the Sans railway station and was only 20 minutes from the airport and downtown by metro was only 10 minutes max. I will definitely be going back ony next visit Show more maninderjit , United Kingdom Expo Barcelona Hotel 7.7 Very good Based on 775 reviews The hotel is excellent to reach and the location feels quite safe even by night for two women. We haven't had breakfast in the hotel as there are quite a few cafés nearby, so we can't commend on that. The room was cleaned okay. The staff did not move the small and light on-board suitcases away during our 4 day stay, so there was a little dust by the second day at this corner. The beds and towels looked clean, and where made/exchanged daily. The built-in hair dryer in the bathroom was a joke. It barely "breathed" warm air, took me nearly 20 minutes just to dry chin length hair. We did not ask for a better hair dryer though. The rooms were narrow, but roomy and had a very barren look. Just plain white walls, a table, one chair and two plain beds that shared a nightstand (without power outlet, those were distributed near the floor at two completely different corners). There was even a small old television (those of the nearly cubicle sort that made the table bend under its weight). Our two single beds were on the smaller side with wheels that squeaked a little when falling onto the bed too hard. They were a little hard, too, which we liked though. There was also a rather roomy walk-in closet. All in all, the hotel was okay. It was the cheapest hotel (~60€/night for a twin double around New Years) that we could get on such short notice that was not a hostel or completely outside the city. It does not earn 4 stars though. I have been in better 3 stars and much better 4 stars for half the price with outstanding service (the service was okay, albeit very "efficient" in communication). Show more Phuong-Ha , Germany Moderno Hotel 7.9 Very good Based on 730 reviews I stayed here for 4 nights returning home yesterday. I had a lovely modern room with a double bed, very comfortable. Everything was spotless, room and hotel very clean. It is right in the centre of Las Ramblas so great location. The bus stop is only around the corner. Metro is also very close. The staff are lovely and very helpful, particularly Javi. I was a solo traveller, and he was very nice and helpful. Breakfast was nice but not a lot of fruit, just a whole apple or orange, (I missed my fruit salad), but that's a small thing. There is no bar, but there is a restaurant next door. Only other negative was that the room had no natural light, as it faced internally, and not much space for clothes if I had not been travelling alone. I think external facing rooms have balconies, but they face the street, so maybe there would be more noise at night. I never heard a sound in my room, and slept very well. All on all, I was very happy with my stay here. Negatives were very small, and for me everything suited my needs. Clean, modern and comfortable, very central, and staff were lovely. I would recommend for solo travellers or couples, and I would stay here again. Show more Marie , Ireland Barcelona Airport Hotel 8 Very good Based on 699 reviews We stayed at BAH after a late night flight arrival pre-cruise as well as prior to our early morning International return flight to USA. Each time the shuttle service was efficient, The hotel is a typical airport hotel - clean with large rooms and free internet. The pool was closed for the season, but we wouldn't have had time to use the facilities anyway. The restaurant menu is limited, but certainly sufficient for our needs. The hotel is located in an industrial park, so don't expect much in terms of alternate dining. There is, however, a coffee shop within walking distance. We heard some people will use the BAH as a base for Barcelona and take the subway and/or bus into the city because the hotel rates are considerably less than staying in the heart of the city. I can't speak personally to this idea because we stayed in an apartment just off Las Ramblas for three nights prior to spending our last night at BAH. BAH was definitely a good hotel for our purposes and I wouldn't hesitate to stay again. Show more Mary , United States Hotel Nouvel 7.9 Very good Based on 86 reviews Great location as a base to explore Barcelona from. Situated in a street corner of the Ramblas, making retreats to room after a long day a good wind down, yet still being close to the charms of Barcelona. Location perfect for easy access to Metros, car rentals, airport bus, Carrefour, shopping, sights - all within 5-15mins walk away. As for the hotel itself, a good comfortable stay. Rooms & beds are small as typical European style, but still sufficient space for 2 big luggages. The bathroom is really pleasant; clean brown marble furnishing with separate shower stall, keeping the sink and toilet area dry always. The frosted glass wall separating the bathroom from room itself is really stylish. Few inconveniences: no mini bar (for keeping yoghurt and fruits), small fee for in-room safe use, deposit for tv remote and chargeable WiFi use ($2euro/hr). Tip: For traveling in Metro/bus, use T-10 tickets. This ticket is sharable (for 2 person use - scan ticket twice on metro/bus entry) and cuts the cost by half. Cost $9.80euro for 10 trips vs $2euro for single tickets. Super convenient and economical for traveling around the city. Show more Ai , Malaysia Pulitzer Hotel 8.5 Excellent Based on 386 reviews Design of the reception, the restaurant and bar is modern and chic. Room is clean with flat screen television, bath robe and warm decor. Location is really great, we shop, drop off our shopping stuff back at the hotel and can head out again as it is near many boutiques, La Bouqueria market, not too far from the Christmas market or the Columbus Monument at the port. The receptionist are cordially polite. However, the reciptionist need to put more effort in improving the knowledge of restaurants and boutiques. As an example, I enquired about the location of Massimo Dutti boutique and I was told of a boutique on Catalunya Rambla No 40 (or 40+ something, cannot quite remember) which took us about 15-20 minutes to walk from the hotel when there is one boutique on the street just behind the hotel, 2 minutes round the corner from hotel. I was really surprised when I saw that Massimo Dutti outlet behind the hotel later. How could the receptionist not know! I also asked the receptionist to assist us to book dinner at the Cal Pep restauarant and I was told that that eatery is a tapas place and no reservation is required. That information was NOT altogether exactly correct as reservation is necessary for any party of 4 and more person. No reservation is needed for 1-3 persons. Show more BEE , Singapore Olivia Plaza Hotel 8.7 Excellent Based on 424 reviews We had 8 nights in Barcelona and initially wanted to stay at different districts. Due to the hassle of moving luggages, we decided to just book one hotel and i guess by sheer luck, we booked Olivia Plaza. The airport transfer which cost 5.90 euros one way stopped 2 mins from this hotel at the plaza Catalunya. So that was amazing. They also provided towels for when you use the shower, of which there is only one on each floor - so if travelling in high season, this should be kept in mind as there will probably be queues longer than the one I experienced (0 people). I missed the duvet cover though. And in 8.56 in the morning it felt like somebody started to bulldoze the very building I was having a good morning sleep in. The walls and floors started to rumble and the noise was so frickin loud, I couldn't even hear my own thoughts, let alone continue to sleep. But the check out is at 11AM, so I guess I just considered the bulldozing as a really irritating alarm clock... Very interesting place for sure. Would recommend for a one night stay for those who are travelling on a budget and wish to experience something amusing in the near-center of BCN. A lot of good places to go out to in the proximity, a nice vibrant night life going on in the surroundings, but it was quiet at night (much more so than in other hotels I have tried in BCN). Oh, and there IS wifi in the rooms!! McCormack ,Australia Discover the neighborhoods of Barcelona Eixample 1152 hotels Gotic 308 hotels Gràcia 278 hotels Sagrada Familia 243 hotels La Rambla 241 hotels Sants-Montjuïc 210 hotels El Poblenou 169 hotels Poble Sec 165 hotels Sant Antoni 152 hotels Sant Gervasi 146 hotels Raval 142 hotels Les Corts 105 hotels Villa Olimpica 98 hotels Hospitalet de Llobregat 88 hotels Horta-Guinardó 81 hotels Sant Martí 71 hotels Barceloneta 57 hotels Sant Andreu 31 hotels Barcelona Airport 17 hotels San Adrian de Besos 13 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Apartments in Barcelona 2113 Guest Houses in Barcelona 318 Hostels in Barcelona 181 Serviced Apartments in Barcelona 83 Resorts in Barcelona 1 More about Barcelona The capital of Catalonia, Barcelona is Spain's most fashionable city. This polished metropolis features world-famous architecture, beautiful museums, and some of the best shopping in Europe. The city is served by Barcelona Airport, a dual-terminal facility located just a few miles outside the city center. Business travelers and those making a short stopover often choose to stay in hotels near Barcelona Airport . The architecture in Barcelona is nothing short of stunning. Most of the buildings in the historic neighborhood of Ciutat Vella were built between the 13th and 15th centuries, laying the foundation for what has become the most complete Gothic quarter in the world. With gargoyles watching from cathedrals and fountains that light up the streets after dark, this is historic Barcelona at its best. Enjoy a stroll down the historic Ramblas Street and experience Barcelona like a local. The neighborhood of Eixample is where some of the most impressive modernist buildings can be found. The most impressive of these is Antoi Gaudi's masterpiece, the Sagrada Familia , which is the most visited monument in Spain. It’s easy to see why Barcelona has been a global sensation for decades. From its bustling Mediterranean port and lively boardwalk to the flamenco dance clubs and, this dynamic city is not one to be missed. There’s much more to see and learn about Barcelona, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this beautiful city.
